properties.name: Day Five: Final Resting Place
properties.description: Posted by Joshuaratliff I arrived in dusty Tulare at about 7:00. I went into the hole in the wall Mexican food place that was there at the truckstop and had nachos that really hit the spot. After talking to a few truckers, as I was trying to catch a ride out of there, I ended up calling it a night, and found a place to crash out.

properties.name: Day Four: Broken and Restored
properties.description: Posted by Joshuaratliff After having missed the voice of the Spirit, walking an extra two miles in the heat, having to carry Yasha back because she was too tired, and finally realizing what had just taken place, I was humbled, I repented, and was filled with joy. He wrapped His arms around me and made me to know that I just needed to trust Him, to wait on Him. He would lead me if I would just be patient and allow Him to. My excuse had been that I was tired, I found that this is maybe an even more important time to listen as I had to walk a whole lot farther because of not listening. I waited about an hour before Nathan stopped to pick me up on his way home from work.

properties.name: Day Four: Final Resting Place
properties.description: Posted by Joshuaratliff When day four was over I crashed hard. I ended up sleeping in a model shed in a Lowes parking lot. I don\'t know how illegal it was, but I felt like that was where I was supposed to stay, so... whatever. Day four was long and hard, and I learned my hardest and maybe most crucial lesson yet. Pretty awesome! Yahuah is so good.

properties.name: Day Four: Realizing I Had Missed It
properties.description: Posted by Joshuaratliff Yasha and I had walked all day, and we were so incredibly tired. At the on ramp before I felt like I was supposed to stand there and wait, but because of my impatience didn\'t wait for very long and ended up walking an extra couple of miles. It was only another mile before we took a nap on the side of the road. When we woke up, I realized that I still couldn\'t get on the Highway (pedestrians prohibited), and the only other options were backwards or dead ends. Let me say I was quite distraught. I called by dad and we prayed for direction. After hanging up the phone I felt it was time to turn back, and go to the same place that I felt that I was supposed to wait before. On the walk back I was pretty broken before the Lord. I repented and asked for forgiveness for having not listened and not waiting on Him. I don\'t think that my disobedience had any real impact on anyone other than myself, because I think that this was factored into the trip. Yahuah used this to reveal that I still had some preconceived ideas and expectations as to how things would go. Praise God for hard lessons.

properties.name: Day Three: Final Resting Place
properties.description: Posted by Joshuaratliff  This is where day three ended as I curled up with Yasha behind a new unoccupied structure near the Starbucks that Shawn and I had walked to. Shawn was a guy that I had met during the day, and we talked for about four hours or so. Overall, a really good day.

properties.name: Day Three: Lunch and Ministering
properties.description: Posted by Joshuaratliff  Wow, I don\'t know how far I walked to get here, but for some reason ( which I now know was Marco) I was hustling all day. I only had to carry Yasha half of the time today... her foot was way better (thanks everybody for the pray). I was sitting at Mcdonalds uploading yesterday\'s update, when this guy commented on my laptop, and then asked what I was using it for. I began talking to him, gave him a card and a pack of Speakables, and then I let him have it. I don\'t usually get to talk to people like that, but he drew it out of me. It was so awesome to meet a brother with an amazing testimony, and craves for more. Eyahuah is awesome!!!

properties.name: Day Two
properties.description: Posted by Joshuaratliff I walked down to Live Oak from Gridley carrying Yasha all the way. The main pad on her front right foot was really swollen after walking so far on day one. We got picked up by a guy named Joseph after eating lunch at subway. The ride was greatly appreciated... I was beat.

properties.name: Day Two (end of the ride)
properties.description: Posted by Joshuaratliff  Joseph dropped us off in Sacramento at a little convenience stop (gas station, Quiznos, mexican food, Starbucks, etc). We got something to drink before Yasha and I took a well needed nap.

properties.name: Day Two (final resting place)
properties.description: Posted by Joshuaratliff I slept "IN A VAN, DOWN BY THE RIVER!!!" lol (a little Chris Farley SNL). Actually I slept under the board walk just a few feet from the water. Not such a bad place to sleep, would\'ve been better if it was flat, but hey, I\'m not complaining. I met a guy, Harry, who claimed not to be homeless and just traveling around, anyways, he seemed nice enough. I gave him a pack of Speakables, the rest of a bag of jerky, and a couple of granola bars. We talked about a bunch of stuff, but he was a little to drunk to go into the gospel too much. Overall, it was a great day filled with walking, talking, frustration, and the peace and comfort of Eyahuah.

properties.name: Drop off day one
properties.description: Posted by Joshuaratliff This is the actual starting point of my trip on 8/2/09. I was dropped off by my parents, and started on this most amazing journey.

properties.name: Starbucks
properties.description: Posted by Joshuaratliff  Today I walked about 15 miles, not bad for my first day and being so out of shape. Yasha and I got picked up and driven the rest of the way into the town of Gridley. It was a beautiful day! Eyahuah is simply amazing.

properties.name: Starting Point
properties.description: Posted by Joshuaratliff 14182 Racine Cir, Magalia, CA 95954My trip began from my parents house in Magalia, CA where my parents live. Set out on 8/1/09

properties.name: Walkabout: All of Day Six
properties.description: Posted by Joshuaratliff It was right here that I spent nine hours of awesome time in the Spirit. It was right here that you can find the nice palm trees from the video under which I took shelter from the sun. Abiding in Yahuah is as simple as waiting, trusting, and enjoying time spent with Him. Living out of this selfless place of joy and peace and life and love was what day six was all about.

properties.name: Walkabout: Day Eight
properties.description: Posted by Joshuaratliff I spent most of the day (about 12 hours or so) right around here. I learned a lot about spiritual warfare, got to pray for and share with some people, and God showed me how much He cares about the details.

properties.name: Walkabout: Day Eight (final resting place)
properties.description: Posted by Joshuaratliff I crashed out behind a small motel out in the dessert at this jam packed truck stop. There were so many people, many of which were coming and going to Las Vegas. The next morning was really good as I spent time in the Spirit and got cleaned up (spiritually) after the previous day.

properties.name: Walkabout: Day Fifteen (final resting place)
properties.description: Posted by Joshuaratliff  I caught a ride from Tabbatha, a mom of three beautiful kids. They were on their way to Moriarty when they stopped to pick me up. I wasn\'t the longest ride, but it sure was a blessing. I hung out at the McDonald\'s for hours, and got to do some videos and share what God\'s been doing. Awesome!!! Yahuah is so incredibly good.

properties.name: Walkabout: Day Fourteen (final resting place)
properties.description: Posted by Joshuaratliff  I stayed at a hotel in Albuquerque after spending the last few nights with my cousin in AZ. It was a really great time. They brought me out to NM before returning home the next day. What a blessing. Thanks Katie and Carl! Love you guys.

properties.name: Walkabout: Day Nine (final resting place)
properties.description: Posted by Joshuaratliff Wow!!! What a blessing. Karolyn picked me up at Kramer Junction in CA and drove me all the way to Williams, AZ. I slept out in the stars; just a gorgeous night. I slept great, and feel great today. It was the first night that I got to truly enjoy the stars and a bit of the wilderness, and other than sleeping at John\'s house it was by far the quietest place that I\'ve slept at. Yahuah is so incredibly good. Halleluyah!!!

properties.name: Walkabout: Day Nine (hanging out and ministering)
properties.description: Posted by Joshuaratliff  Today I hung out in Flagstaff. I had multiple opportunities to minister directly to people, as well as about two hours that I got to spend praying and ministering on the side of the road. By far this was the most powerful day I have ever had in the spirit. Way cool!

properties.name: Walkabout: Day Seven (final resting place)
properties.description: Posted by Joshuaratliff I got to stay another night at John\'s house before heading back out on the road. Day seven (the Sabbath day) was a day of rest, and I just got to relax and catch up on my updates and stuff. It was such a blessing to have a nice comfy bed to sleep in and to get cleaned up (both me and my clothes... nice not to be so stinky lol). I got to talk and share a little with John, and hearing what he\'s been through broke me. The morning of the eighth day I wept for him, praying that he would let down his guard and give himself to Yahuah with all of the junk that has been swept under the rug. It was so good to have met John, he was such a blessing.

properties.name: Walkabout: Day Ten - Thirteen (final resting place)
properties.description: Posted by Joshuaratliff My cousin and her husband came and picked me up in Flagstaff, and I\'m enjoying a few days of rest. I haven\'t seen her in like four years or so, and it\'s been really cool to be here with her, and to meet her husband. Thank God for rest, but I\'m ready to get back out on the road.

properties.name: Walkabout: Resting Place Day Six (the Adventures of Rick and John)
properties.description: Posted by Joshuaratliff John and Rick picked me up about 30 miles out of Bakersfield and brought me home. I got to shower, shave, wash my clothes, eat an insane feast of a dinner, and sleep an a super comfy bed. WOW!!! Yahuah\'s provision is amazing.
